src:
Anggaran Terbatas, BNN Provinsi Kaltara Ungkap TPPU Penjualan Narkoba
01 Nov 2019, 22:35 by Denisa Tristianty


Anggaran Terbatas, BNN Provinsi Kaltara Ungkap TPPU Penjualan Narkoba

Jakarta, KBRN : Badan Narkotika Nasional Provinsi Kalimantan Utara berhasil mengungkap Tindak Pidana Pencucian Uang (TPPU) dari kasus narkoba."Ada dua tersangka kasus TPPU yakni Hendro Setiawan dan Nasruddin. Namun, untuk perkara Hendro diambil alih BNN Pusat, karena BNNP Kaltara hanya memiliki ketersediaan anggaran untuk satu perkara TPPU," kata Kepala BNNP Kaltara, Brigjen Pol Herry Dahana di Tarakan, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Jumat (1/11/2019).Kasus TPPU yang ditanggani BNNP Kaltara saat ini ada satu, sesuai dengan dukungan anggaran dari BNN Pusat, katanya.Hendro merupakan salah satu tersangka dalam perkara 2,4 kilogram yang diungkap BNN Pusat, BNNP Kaltara dan Bea Cukai Tarakan beberapa waktu lalu.Tersangka ini merupakan pengendali sabu 2,4 kilogram yang diambil dari wilayah perairan Malaysia. Hendro diamankan di Bogor, setelah lima orang kurirnya ditangkap pertengahan Oktober lalu.“Dukungan anggaran kita memang satu kasus TPPU untuk 2019 ini, jadi diserap cuma satu. Jadi, pertanggungjawaban keuangan cuma kasus, untuk TPPU Nasruddin,” katanya.Aset yang berhasil disita diantaranya bangunan dan tanah dan barang bergerak.Nasrudin sebenarnya baru saja divonis 13 tahun penjara. Perkara TPPU ini berarti merupakan kasus ketiga yang menjeratnya. Dua perkara sebelumnya terjadi di tahun 2018. Awalnya Nasruddin menjadi DPO di perkara 1 kg sabu, namun tertangkap Satuan Reskoba Polres Tarakan untuk kepemilikan sabu di bawah 5 gram.“Waktu kami mengamankan Nasrudin, ada buku rekening yang kami sita. Ada uang Rp600 juta dalam buku rekening," kata Herry.Sedangkan pada tersangka Hendro, ada dua unit mobil yang diamankan dan diduga kendaraan ini direntalkan. (ANTARA FOTO / Irwansyah Putra/hp)
text:
Limited Budget, Kaltara Province BNN Reveals TPPU on Drug Sales
01 Nov 2019, 22:35 by Denisa Tristianty


Limited Budget, Kaltara Province BNN Reveals TPPU on Drug Sales

Jakarta, KBRN: North Kalimantan National Narcotics Agency succeeded in uncovering the Money Laundering (TPPU) of drug cases. "There are two TPPU suspects namely Hendro Setiawan and Nasruddin. However, for the Hendro case the Central BNNP was taken over, because the BNNP Kaltara only has budget availability for one TPPU case, "said the Head of BNNP Kaltara, Brig. Gen. Herry Dahana in Tarakan, as reported by Antara News Agency, Friday (1/11/2019). The TPPU case that the BNNP Kaltara currently holds is one, in line with budget support. from the Central BNN, he said. Hendro was one of the suspects in the 2.4 kilogram case that was revealed by the Central BNN, Kaltara BNNP and Tarakan Customs some time ago. This suspect was a 2.4 kilogram methamphetamine controller taken from Malaysian waters. Hendro was secured in Bogor, after five of his couriers were arrested in mid-October. "Our budget support is indeed one TPPU case for 2019, so only one absorbed. So, financial accountability is only a case, for TPPU Nasruddin, "he said. The assets that were successfully seized included buildings and land and movable property. Nasrudin was actually just sentenced to 13 years in prison. This TPPU case means it is the third case that ensnared it. Two previous cases occurred in 2018. Initially Nasruddin was a DPO in the case of 1 kg of methamphetamine, but the Tarakan Police Reskoba Unit was arrested for possession of methamphetamine below 5 grams. "When we secured Nasrudin, there was an account book that we confiscated. There is Rp. 600 million in the account book, "said Herry. As for the suspect Hendro, there were two units of cars that were secured and this vehicle was allegedly thrown. (ANTARA PHOTO / Irwansyah Putra / handphone)
